quesadilla13
2 contributions

Highly recommend this bike tour!

Jun 2025 • Solo
I was the only one who booked this tour for my time slot, so I got a personal bike tour of the city! My guide was extremely kind and professional. He took me to all the "must see" attractions in Lima. Through this tour, I feel like I got a perfect introduction to the city and I was better able to navigate through the rest of my time. Thanks so much!
Written June 30, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

2 contributions

Great city cycling tour!

Mar 2025 • Couples
Such a good way to see the city of Lima and the areas of Miraflores and Barranco. Our guide was great and explained everything really well. Was just two of us so we basically got a private tour! Definitely the best priced tour in the area and a super friendly service
Written March 24, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Fabian G
13 contributions

Memorable and affordable adventure in Lima

Apr 2024 • Couples
Our recent bike tour along Lima's coast was a delightful experience! Despite its brevity, every moment was filled with the refreshing sea breeze and picturesque views. The tour was worth every penny spent, offering a perfect blend of relaxation and exploration. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable and affordable adventure in Lima that does not take too much of your time!
Written May 14, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Nice afternoon on the bike

Dec 2023 • Solo
Nice tour along the boardwalks of Miraflores, Barranco and Chorrillos, all on bicycle tracks. Guide with good knowledge of the places where we stop. Robust and comfortable bicycles.
Written December 20, 2023

Dordrecht, The Netherlands71 contributions

Great bicycle trip in Lima!!!

We had a great v
Bicycle city tour with Anthony Salazar. We had a great time with Antony Salazar. We went all the way to the statue of Jesus. A good climb but well worth it. All the different neighbourhoods haf their own identity. Anthony learned us a lot. THANK YOU! Afterwards we went for lunch with Anthony, thanks for that!
We can recommend the tour!!!
John and Peta Tims, Hollanda
Written September 7, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
JSB1979
United States201 contributions

Good, but not great

Aug 2022
Biking in Lima is great. Lima is flat and the weather is never too hot. I do recommend that highly. The paths by the ocean are well-maintained and safe.

However, Mirabici's bikes are heavy and rusty. Their helmets do not seem fully sanitized and they do not require riders to wear a hairnet. Mirabici is practically the only place you can rent a kids' bike from, and that's a plus.
Written August 29, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Kyle
1 contribution

Awesome way to see Lima and get a nice workout in the process

Dec 2021
We had an incredible 3 (or so) hour tour with Gerard through Miraflores south down the coast and made it up the side of the mountainous Morro Solar lookout. We stopped along the way, got some good tidbits of information about Lima and had an excellent workout in the process.

Would recommend for those that like seeing sights, are intermediate bikers and aren’t afraid of a little sweat. Gerard was super friendly and knowledgeable and got a ton of great photos for us. Thanks Mirabici!
Written December 21, 2021
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Morgan, Nadia, and Orly
1 contribution

We loved the trip with Junior!

Feb 2020
Junior gave us an excellent tour of Miraflores, Barranco, and Chorrillos! He was very kind and knowledgeable and was very willing to practice Spanish with us. We even got to eat a delicious ceviche along the way! Highly recommend taking this tour with Junior, he is the best guide ever :)
Written February 27, 2020
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Hola, puedo hacer la compra en el momento de realizar el tour?
Written July 14, 2019

Hola, lo mejor es reservar un horario porque no salen todo el tiempo, también podes alquilar una bicicleta y recorrer sin guía, el camino es fácil
Written July 16, 2019

Kressbronn am Bodensee, Germany

Hi, your tour looks good. I am a solo traveller, please tell me how I book the tour for Saturday, 9th February. Many thanks, Stew
Written February 5, 2019
lindaS3713RT
Hacienda Heights, California
6 contributions
We are planning family trip (eight adults) for May 2019. How steep is the climb to the top of the cliff for views of ocean. How long is that climb? Linda Fletcher
Written July 26, 2018
Kimberly H
Richmond, Virginia
12 contributions
LInda - the climb is pretty steep, but Miguel (or another guide) prefaces that you can walk the climb if the ride is too steep (I walked the last bit of it). Google maps is showing it's about 600 yards long. If you type in Acceso Tenderini, Distrito de Chorrillos 15063 into Google street view, you'll see the start of the climb and follow Salida a Boulevard Herradura toward Mirador Herradura.
